result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Torrance Demetrius Richardson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Torrance Demetrius Richardson appeared by video.  Attorney Michael L. Chernin appeared by video for Torrance Demetrius Richardson.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.
Scheduling conference scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 094535,
Payable Number: 1036855,
Receipt Number: 22RP039925,
Amount: $20.00

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 09-16-2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with YSW.

Defendant Torrance Richardson. Attorney Chernin in court for defendant. Attorney Ringersma in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02 .Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing. Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
